VRChat lets you fully embody custom avatars, play social games, and connect with friends in new ways. 

VRChat hosts a massive global community of gamers, musicians, creators, artists, entertainers and more. 

You can also build and share your own creations with the community.

PRIVACY POLICY
Effective Date: May 31, 2017

This Privacy Policy (Policy) describes the manner in which VRChat, Inc. (VRChat, we, or us) and our website at www.vrchat.com (our Site), as well as all related websites, networks, desktop or mobile clients and applications, and other services provided by us and on which a link to this Policy is displayed (collectively, together with the Site, our Service) collect, use, and disclose information about you. This Policy is incorporated into and is subject to the VRChat Terms of Use and End User License Agreement. By using the Service, you consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of your information as described in this Policy.

Information We Collect on the Service

User-provided Information:

When you use the Service, we may collect or you may provide information about you and we may link this information with other information about you. You may provide us with information in various ways on the Service. For example, you provide us with information when you register for an account (we will collect your email address, birthday, and allow you to create a username and password), subscribe to our newsletters, use the Service, make a purchase on the Service, or send us customer service-related requests.

Cookies and Automatically Collected Information:

When you use the Service, we may send one or more cookies  small text files containing a string of alphanumeric characters  to your device. We may use both session cookies and persistent cookies. A session cookie disappears after you close your browser. A persistent cookie remains after you close your browser and may be used by your browser on subsequent visits to the Service. Please review your web browser Help" file to learn the proper way to modify your cookie settings. Please note that if you delete, or choose not to accept, cookies from the Service, you may not be able to utilize the features of the Service to their fullest potential. We may use third party cookies on our Service as well. For instance, we use Google Analytics to collect and process certain analytics data. To learn more about how Google Analytics uses your information and what choices you have, please visit www.google.com/policies/privacy/partners/. VRChat does not process or respond to web browsers do not track signals or other similar transmissions that indicate a request to disable online tracking of users who use our Service.

We may also automatically record certain information from your device by using various types of technology, including clear gifs" or web beacons. This automatically collected information may include your IP address or other device address or ID, web browser and/or device type, the web pages or sites that you visit just before or just after you use the Service, the pages or other content you view or otherwise interact with on the Service, and the dates and times that you visit, access, or use the Service. We also may use these technologies to collect information regarding your interaction with email messages, such as whether you opened, clicked on, or forwarded a message. This information is gathered from all users, and may be connected with other information about you.

Information Disclosed While Using the Service:

When using the Service, including participation in different rooms made available to users of the virtual-reality component of our Service, you may disclose to us and to other users of the Service information about you. This may occur when you engage in conversations, chats, or other user-to-user interactions. We may collect and use this information to the extent permitted by law.

Payment Information:

If you choose to access or use parts of the Service that require payments or fees, we may require you to provide financial information to us for the purpose of processing those payments. We may provide your payment information to third party payment processors who process transactions on our behalf. We may also collect and retain information relating to the transactions you conduct.

Location Information:

We may use your IP address to obtain general information about the physical location from which you are connecting to the Internet.

Third Party Web Beacons and Third Party Buttons:

We may display third-party content on the Service, including third-party advertising. Third-party content may use cookies, web beacons, or other mechanisms for obtaining data in connection with your viewing of the third party content on the Service. Additionally, we may implement third party buttons (such as Facebook like or share buttons) that may function as web beacons even when you do not interact with the button. Information collected through third-party web beacons and buttons is collected directly by these third parties, not by VRChat. Information collected by a third party in this manner is subject to that third partys own data collection, use, and disclosure policies. Please note that privacy choices you have made on VRChat will not carry over to third party sites or services (and vice-versa).

Information from Other Sources:

We may obtain information from third parties and sources other than the Service, such as our partners and advertisers.

How We Use the Information We Collect. We use information we collect on the Service (in both individual and aggregate format) in a variety of ways in providing the Service and operating our business, including the following

We use the information that we collect on the Service to operate, maintain, enhance and provide the Service, to provide services and information that you request, to respond to comments and questions and otherwise to provide support to users, and to process and deliver entries and rewards in connection with promotions that may be offered from time to time on the Service.

We use the information that we collect on the Service to understand and analyze the usage trends and preferences of our users, to improve the Service, and to develop new products, services, features, and functionality.

We may use your email address or other information we collect to contact you for administrative purposes such as customer service or to send communications, including required notices, marketing communications, or updates on promotions and events relating to products and services offered by us and by third parties.

We may use information to: (i) personalize our Service, such as remembering information about you so that you will not have to re-enter it during your visit or the next time you visit the Service; (ii) provide customized advertisements, content, and information; (iii) monitor and analyze the effectiveness of the Service and third-party marketing activities; (iv) monitor aggregate site usage metrics such as total number of visitors and pages viewed; (v) track your entries, submissions, and status in any promotions or other activities on the Service; and (vi) detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, intellectual property infringement, violations of our Terms of Use, violations of law, or other misuse of the Service.

When We Disclose Information. Except as described in this Policy, we will not disclose information about you that we collect on the Service to third parties without your consent. We may disclose information to third parties if you consent to us doing so, as well as in the following circumstances

We work with third party service providers who provide website, application development, hosting, payment, maintenance, and other services for us. These third parties may have access to or process information about you as part of providing those services for us. We require our service providers to agree to maintain the confidentiality of such information.

We may disclose information about you if required to do so by law or in the good-faith belief that such action is necessary to comply with state and federal laws, in response to a court order, judicial or other government subpoena or warrant, or to otherwise cooperate with law enforcement or other governmental agencies.

We also reserve the right to disclose information about you that we believe, in good faith, is appropriate or necessary to (i) take precautions against liability, (ii) protect ourselves or others from fraudulent, abusive, or unlawful uses or activity, (iii) investigate and defend ourselves against any third-party claims or allegations, (iv) protect the security or integrity of the Service and any facilities or equipment used to make the Service available, or (v) protect our property or other legal rights (including, but not limited to, enforcement of our agreements), or the rights, property, or safety of others.

Information about our users may be disclosed and otherwise transferred to an acquirer, successor, or assignee as part of any merger, acquisition, debt financing, sale of assets, or similar transaction, or in the event of an insolvency, bankruptcy, or receivership in which information is transferred to one or more third parties as one of our business assets.

We may make certain aggregate or otherwise non-personal or de-identified information available to third parties for various purposes, including (i) compliance with various reporting obligations; (ii) for business or marketing purposes; or (iii) to assist such parties in understanding our users interests, habits, and usage patterns for certain programs, content, services, advertisements, promotions, and/or functionality available through the Service.

Your Choices

You may, of course, decline to share certain information with us, in which case we may not be able to provide to you some of the features and functionality of the Service. You may update your profile information through the Service. If you wish to access, update, delete or amend any other personal information we hold about you, you may contact us at support@vrchat.com. Please note that while any changes you make will be reflected in active user databases within a reasonable period of time, we may retain all information you submit for backups, archiving, prevention of fraud and abuse, analytics, satisfaction of legal obligations, or where we otherwise reasonably believe that we have a legitimate reason to do so.

If you receive commercial email from us, you may unsubscribe at any time by following the instructions contained within the email. You may also opt out from receiving commercial email from us by sending your request to us by email at support@vrchat.com or by writing to us at the address given at the end of this policy. We may allow you to view and modify settings relating to the nature and frequency of promotional communications that you receive from us in user account functionality on the Service.

Please be aware that if you opt out of receiving commercial email from us or otherwise modify the nature or frequency of promotional communications you receive from us, it may take up to ten business days for us to process your request, and you may continue receiving promotional communications from us during that period. Additionally, even after you opt out from receiving commercial messages from us, you will continue to receive administrative messages from us regarding the Service.

Third-Party Services

The Service may contain features or links to websites and services provided by third parties. Any information you provide on third-party sites or services is provided directly to the operators of such services and is subject to those operators policies, if any, governing privacy and security, even if accessed through the Service. We are not responsible for the content or privacy and security practices and policies of third-party sites or services to which links or access are provided through the Service. We encourage you to learn about third parties privacy and security policies before providing them with information.

Childrens Privacy

Our Site is a general audience site not directed to children under the age of 13, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the age of 13 without obtaining parental consent. If you become aware that your child or any child under your care has provided us with information without your consent, please contact us at the contact information listed below and we will delete any such account or profile and associated information.

Data Security

We use certain physical, managerial, and technical safeguards that are designed to improve the integrity and security of information that we collect and maintain. Please be aware that no security measures are perfect or impenetrable. We cannot and do not guarantee that information about you will not be accessed, viewed, disclosed, altered, or destroyed by breach of any of our physical, technical, or managerial safeguards.

International Visitors

The Service is hosted in the United States. If you choose to use the Service from the European Union or other regions of the world with laws governing data collection and use that may differ from U.S. law, then please note that you are transferring your personal information outside of those regions to the United States for storage and processing. Also, we may transfer your data from the United States to other countries or regions in connection with storage and processing of data, fulfilling your requests, and operating the Service. By providing any information, including personal information, on or to the Service, you consent to such transfer, storage, and processing.

Changes and Updates to this Policy

Please revisit this page periodically to stay aware of any changes to this Policy, which we may update from time to time. If we modify this Policy, we will make it available through the Service, and indicate the effective date. In the event that the modifications materially alter your rights or obligations hereunder, we will make reasonable efforts to notify you of the change. For example, we may send a message to your email address, if we have one on file, or generate a pop-up or similar notification when you access the Service for the first time after such material changes are made. Your continued use of the Service after the revised Policy has become effective indicates that you have read, understood and agreed to the current version of this Policy.

How to Contact Us

Please contact us with any questions or comments about this Policy, information we have collected or otherwise obtained about you, our use and disclosure practices, or your consent choices by email at support@vrchat.com.

MrCanada18 days ago
Fantastic fun, made numerous friends

Now first things first, Vrchat is less of a game and much more of a social platform. Sure you can play certain games once inside but it's main strength is the conversations with friends or newly acquainted people.

Since starting about a month from now, I've made a group of friends who I'd say are closer friends to me then my real friends. It's allowed me to communicate and make friends when beforehand I thought doing so would be impossible for me.

Now I LOVE Vrchat, and I'd recommend it anyone who likes meeting new people. However we do need to talk about the negatives.
Starting off:

-Performance issues: VRchat gives users the ability to create their own avatars to better express themselves, however this does lead to avatars that tend to lag the quests hardware and push it to its limits. You're lucky to push past 20 fps at any given time.

-Bugs and crashes: Due to the aforementioned performance issues, you get bugs like "Black Squares" which occur often. The fix for this is to simply press your power button once, wait for the beep, then press the button again.
Crashes occur often, and when they do they can range from simply sending you back to your menu to completely crashing your system and forcing you to hold your power button until a reset occurs.

-Toxic people: This is not a big issue but I figure it's something worth mentioning, I've RARELY met people like this, but when you do it can completely ruin your mood or even your day. When these people show up they're usually quite aggressive and tend to get on your nerves especially if you're of a younger age (12 and under)

Now VRchat has implemented a system to help with this and EVERYONE who plays should get acquainted with these two things. If a player is harassing you or others, simply open your menu, point your laser at them, and click until their profile pops up. Once it does, you have two options. You can either mute them, which simply stops your ability to hear them, or you can block them. If you mute a person, and they begin getting in your face or "physically" annoying you, blocking them is ALWAYS an option.

When you block a person, they can no longer speak to you, see you, or select your profile. You can still unblock them by going to the social tab, however you can't hear or see them until you do so. DON'T BE AFRAID TO BLOCK AND OR MUTE THOSE WHO ARE ANNOYING OR HARRESING YOU, it's very important you enjoy your time in VRchat, and you don't want your experience to be ruined by toxic people.

Be aware, this also applies to you. Don't get in other users faces, don't say things you wouldn't like said to you, and try to have respect for everyone around you and you wont have to worry about other users muting or blocking you.

VRchat is a fantastic place to make friends and play a few games from time to time, and hay, it's free so what could possibly go wrong in trying it out? Users like myself are usually in the Quest hub world helping newbies out, so if you're struggling, don't be afraid to ask others for assistance. Have fun :)

VrylxJun 21 at 12:31 PM
Great game + how to fix glitch

VRChat is a great game. Especially if you want to interact with someone who lives far away. However the game does glitch out often if you play it a lot. One of the most common glitches Ive noticed is black squares or patches appearing on screen and sometimes flashing. Luckily there is an easy fix. Simply tap your power button, and then tap it again. Thats it, youre done. You dont even have to leave the game or reset your oculus. Just tap the power, let it go full black for a second, then tap it again to turn back on, and boom youve basically just reset your display. Easy right?

Now, heads up to new players. If youre just starting out, you MUST go to your settings and turn on comfort turning so you dont get sick or feel disoriented. Honestly not sure why its not turned on by default. Also be prepared to run into weird stuff. People are weird. If youre a parent, wondering for your kid, I would say dont let them play unless theyre at least 13. Besides, the oculus is designed to only be played by 13+ anyway.

TheSpoon7784Feb 26 at 7:47 AM
Great... but limited

This is probably my most played game on the Quest, and my favorite multiplayer social environment on it, but the Quest port is far from perfect. It does have bugs, can be prone to frame rate issues, and is limited in terms of seeing avatars/worlds. This does not bother me though, and I still get truly memorable experiences in it, but this can definitely be a turn-off/disappointment for some people.

Pros: Most of what makes VRChat unique on PCVR is also what makes it great on the Quest. Considering the app is free, there's no reason not to at least try it out.

Cons: The game is pretty well optimized for the Oculus Quest, but it still isn't perfect at times. As well, not being to see most PC avatars, or even have the option to, is unfortunate. Most lobbies you join there will be at least one 'PC robot' around. That being said, it doesn't ruin the experience completely.

Some of the performance issues I encounter are likely because I enable seeing all high-poly avatars, and disable all safety settings, but I assume at least some of these issues translate to other people.

Will likely update this review in the future, but this is my current opinion on the app. Hope it helps.

llulenDec 13 at 10:25 PM
Great game, really helps me out

I have a really bad case with social anxiety. I hate crowds, I think everyone is looking at me, I barely like conversing with others. I am always better at talking through text messages or some other way of communication. Although it is similar to real life, big crowds in some places and what not, it actually helps me with my anxiety issue. I've made friends way faster than when I try to make friends in real life. Thank you, VRChat.

Although... there are the downsides of Quest VRC. Mostly the one thing being about Quest users not being able to see PC avatars. It doesn't really affect anything in the game, but for some it can get really annoying when you're playing a game like Murder 2 or 3 and you can't seem to get a PC player's hitbox right. As they can be really small and you would never know unless you asked or heard about it.

I don't really have anything against the Trust Leveling System. It's annoying, sure. But gives me a reason to play more if I ever want to get Trusted or Known.

Anyway, I should wrap this up. Great game, I play this hours on end. Even fall asleep while in it- Thank you for making such a game available for us Quest users.

WaveEffectFeb 18 at 1:35 AM
Its the store brand version of VRChat

Its VRChat, no doubts there. Its the whole game, just with some restrictions. You cant see the majority of avatars due to them being PC players and the Quest apparently wasnt able to handle them so theyre disabled. Some worlds do not load properly and youre plopped down on some basic map geometry/model devoid of any textures or skins. Others will work completely fine. There are definitely Quest supported worlds and avatars, labeled as Cross-Platform respectively. While that works for some, the problem is that a large majority of the player base can be difficult to access due to the restrictions.

So thats about it. As long as your okay with using Cross-Platform worlds and avatars, youll get the experience of VRChat. Oh, and the microphone actually works on this version unlike playing over Oculus Link.

Looking at you, Oculus...

KorvuDec 15 at 10:30 AM
A solid port with some notable caveats

VRChat's been out on the PC for a while, and considering the Quest port is essentially running entirely off of a modified version of android and it's still cross-system with PC players, it's overall pretty impressive that the game works without too many compromises. The biggest issue stems from those compromises.
If you've played VRChat on PC, you might have noticed that worlds and avatars in the file browser have "PC" and "Quest" indicators on them. Only avatars with the Quest indicator on them will load up properly when you're playing, they're essentially less detailed models that are designed to render better on lower-end hardware. If you encounter a PC player using a non-Quest compatible avatar, they will instead appear as a brown robot. You can still interact and talk with those players like anyone else, but they'll stay as the robot unless they happen to change to a Quest-compatible model.
The VRChat Devs have been trying to encourage players to re-do their models to make them Quest-compatible, but most people haven't bothered. What this means for you is that most public areas will often be full of brown placeholder robots. This isn't a deal-breaker since you can still chat with them, but it's still a big disappointment since the avatars are a big part of the game.

VRChat is suppose to be a fun experience for anyone to enjoy social activities with other people, but I find it to be unpleasant to my eyes and senses. People that get VR sickness should stay away until they fix the problems it has! The times it would freeze randomly it would make me want to vomit all over myself.. The Windows version claims it can run on a GTX 970, but I beg to differ that you would need at least a 1080 Ti or higher for it to run near 60fps during crowded places. On the Quest if youre in a world with more than 3 people be prepared that the frames drop significantly and your eyes will bug out seeing other peoples avatars jitter. There are comfort options that you can choose from which would be useful to people like myself but its pretty much useless, because of its performance.. When this app was first available on the Quest it had a comfort rating to be comfortable. I guess with all the jittering Oculus had to change it to intense due to others complaining about the problems. I completely understand that some avatars and worlds are not accessible on the Quest, because it doesnt have the horse power behind it to run them. Those that complain about it doesnt understand how hardware works so they tried the best they could to bring the experience here. The thing is though.. It still has a lot of problems for it to work smoothly.. VRChat is an unoptimized mess for Windows and its even worse on the Quest. When the developers released this product on PC they shouldve put in limitations for how many polys and particles custom avatars and worlds can use. This is why it has its issues today. On PC there are users with different specs. Some have very powerful and expensive parts while others are on a budget. So when they try to cram the game into a device like the Quest people wont be pleased by the outcome.. Anyway... let me get back to the Quest.. Ive had maybe 3 hours of messing around with this since the Quest was released and sure every update it gets better, but not by enough. Today was a great example for how unstable this app can be.. I played it for 30 minutes and it crashed on me 3 times! Why is it that AltSpaceVR was pushed by Oculus to be more optimized (Even though it runs so much better than VRChat) while this gets released with the issues it has?! It clearly makes no sense to me... for how unoptimized this game is.. they really need to start from scratch and rewrite it from the ground up.. Anyway.. Oculus if you can read this.. Please get on top of these developers and push them to make the experience better.

SofiaQyvalarJul 16, 2019 at 2:59 AM
A severely limited experience

I was so eager to thrust myself into the amazing worlds that VRCHAT promises. And why not? It's free, after all!

However, do keep in mind that the quest port is severely limited. And even understanding where those limits come from, I still think a few things could have been done better to get over those limits.

Obviously, the one we all know: PC avatars aren't visibile for quest users. While this is understadable, what I do not understand is why the generic "floating robot" that replaces them don't at least TRY to replicate the size, or at least position, of the pc user's actual avatar. Instead they all float at the same generic height, do the same generic moves. You can't even understand when they're interacting with you, their arms and boides are no way connected to your phisicality.

Levels. It seems like a vast amount of worlds are just pc only. Undersandable, again, if it wasn't that most of the userbase prefers using those worlds. The result is that the quest optimized worlds are almost exclusively empty. It's very rare to encounter anyone.

The cross-compatible levels have some brutal limitations to make them available to quest users. Most props are just removed from the quest end, making for some very awkward interactions. Most props on quest in general are limted, in fact. In number, and in actual functionality. And video players are gone.

That's right. No video players. Forget doing karaoke, watching a movie together, search for memes, listen to music..

I really cannot understand disabling such a basic social function. Especially considering it works on basically every other quest app.

PlatMan17Jun 7, 2019 at 3:33 PM
A new age for VR chat

Having been to dozens of different social worlds in VR chat on the Quest, I think it's safe to say that Quest owners will find social spaces that are different from the apocalyptically chaotic meme graveyards that YouTube montages of VR chat painted it to be. Several worlds have unique (clunky) mechanics like hide-n-seek, archery, racing and falling to your death, many with some amusingly trippy and surreal aesthetic, in fact, so far the worlds the Quest port and impressively create are easily the craziest part of the game itself. The communities I have butted in on were equally as fun to spend my time with, as so far most players dont play meme songs on full blast, but rather maintain great often memorable conversations almost consistently (mainly the new people with the Quest launch and Vive players) . However, due to VR chats unpredictable nature and numerous Respawn related problems that will hit players visiting worlds populated by PC players, not everyone will get as much out of it as others, but it's free price definitely makes worth a few glances, it is likely changing for the better community wise after all.
